channel.title: Forum Software
channel.description: I'm looking for a forum software that does not use SQL. Or any other language like Perl or Java. I'm wondering if it would be easier to create my own, and if I were to. What language might I use? I really just want one that is VERY simple, just tables. Nothing like profles or anything. No real log in system, maybe just an account and a password. A way to censor words, and edit posts. If it's not possible without MySQL, then I'm willing to use it. I just need something for a class project.

item.title: Forum Software
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

Just run XAMPP as you suggested. It would be weird if you will be running a web server but unable to run a database?

phpBB all the way.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Software
item.dc:creator: @belbn belbn
item.description:
@belbn wrote:

You could easily take something like phpbb and change some of the function to instead connect to a database just read a bunch of text files. I would recommend just using something like freemysql.net and setting it up standard.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Software
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

I could make a joke about how all proper people use brains, without it they can’t make intelligent posts…

But I think I’ll just suffice by saying that there are alternatives to SQL…

item.description:
@natex wrote:

All proper forums use sql without it people cant register and stuff.

item.title: Forum Software
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

just use punbb and be done with it.

and why do you want something that doesnt use sql? thats terribly stupid

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Software
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

If you took some time to read the topic, you would understand that I am simply using this for a class project. I’m not paying anything for a class project. And I don’t want anything with SQL. I don’t need your tips for forum softwares. I have used those before. I was just asking for something between the lines of what I gave.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Software
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

I don’t know of any that don’t use mySql, but i do know some good ones that do
SMF (not smfforfree) price - free
vBulletin price - i think its like $180 usd but you CAN get it free
IPB price - $150 usd or $300 usd (depending on the liscense type) and once again, you can get this for free

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Software
item.dc:creator: @wingsword97 wingsword97
item.description:
@wingsword97 wrote:

[quote=“YupolaScape, post:7, topic:205314”][quote author=wingsword97 link=topic=270979.msg2255873#msg2255873 date=1212356686]
vbulletin uses sql but its easy to figure out…i ask alpha and he said its easy, which he has a very nice board
[/quote]
VB is also £90, and he would prefer it not to be in SQL. So try to think what your saying when you try to answer a question.[/quote]
He simply asked for good forum software, and i answered in a polite way.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Software
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I’m still looking for a good forum software. Even though the project is over. I just wanted it to be without SQL, so I wouldn’t have to install it for a class project. I still need it to match the description. Someone was making a Forum Software on MITB at on point, but I think they quit, it was really nice.

Read full topic

item.description:

well since it is a class project, maybe the teacher does not have the MySQL thing set up or w/e.
Anyway, It is possible without MySQL, but it is a HUGE pain in the butt. you can use some special characters to do separations, or otherwise.
